intro: Nothochilus, commonly known as the "false lily of the valley," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Primulaceae. It consists of several species native to the Andes mountains in South America. The plants are herbaceous perennials with showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. They produce small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Nothochilus species are often cultivated for their ornamental value and are adapted to cool, moist environments.
